                          Subject: DSC-7-Physical Chemistry-II: Chemical Kinetics & Thermodynamics                   NaN
                                                  Credit: 04 (T) + 02 (P) Total learning hours: 60                   NaN
                                                                               Course description:                   NaN
  This Course Paper proposes to teach about: The chemical kinetics, order of reaction, theories of                   NaN
                           reaction rate, kinetics of complex and chemical reactions, applications of chemical kinetics,
   thermodynamics equilibrium and processes, work and energy, entropy, enthalpy, free energy, laws                   NaN
                        of thermodynamics, important equations their derivations and applications.                   NaN
                                                                         Student learning outcome:                   NaN
    After completing this course, the students will be able to learn: Order, molecularity, rate of                   NaN
chemical reactions – factors affecting it, kinetics and theories of complex and chemical reactions                   NaN
and applications in various fields, objectives and limitations of thermodynamic processes, laws of                   NaN
thermodynamics and its’ significance, enthalpy, entropy, free energy, various isotherms, equations                   NaN
                                                                           and their applications.                   NaN

                                                     Subject: DSC-8- Inorganic Chemistry-III                      NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                                                                     Credit: 04 (T) + 02 (P) Total learning hours: 60        NaN        NaN        NaN
                                                                         Course description:                      NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                                                   This course provides an overview of d and   f-block elements, many  important    aspects         of
         coordination compounds, inorganic polymers, non-aqueous solvents and some ceramics.                      NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
Course comprises of information about coordination compounds and organometallic compounds as                      NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                                             well as basics of inorganic polymers and cages.                      NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                                                                   Student learning outcome:                      NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                                              Upon completion of this course, students will:                      NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                          • Have a deep knowledge regarding lanthanide and actinide elements                      NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                  • Be able to understand various theories related to coordination compounds                      NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                                    • Have systematic understanding organometallic compounds                      NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                                         • Come to know about pros and cons of radioactivity                      NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                                  • Get an idea regarding inorganic cages and metal clusters                      NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                                                 • Be familiar with solvent other than water                      NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Subject: SEC-2: Green Chemistry                                                                        NaN
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         Credit: 04 (T) + 02(P)                                                   Total learning hours: 60
Course description: This course provides an overview of fundamental topics in green chemistry.\rGreen Chemistry is the design of chemical products and processes that reduce or eliminate the use\rand generation of hazardous substances. While there are many mechanisms and tools available\rto assess the impact of materials and processes on human health and the environment, there are few\rtools available to help design and create products as such.\rThis course will present the fundamentals of the 12 principles of green chemistry, and explore\rrelevant examples of their practical use in commercial applications.\rThiscoursewillexploreexamplesfromawidespectrumofindustrialsectorsincluding\rconstruction, personal care, pharmaceuticals and electronics.\rThroughexamples,studentswillbepresentedwiththepremisethatgreenchemistryoffers\rorganizations a boost to innovation and faster time to market. This course provides an overview of fundamental topics in green chemistry.

Program: B.Sc. (Sem-IV) Type: Theory                 Unnamed: 0 Unnamed: 1 Unnamed: 2 Unnamed: 3
                                                        Subject: DSE-4-Nanoscience and Nanotechnology                        NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                                                              Credit: 02 (T) Total learning hours: 30                        NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                                           Course description: Nanoscience is the study of structures           and molecules on        the      scale         of
  nanometers and the technology which utilizes it in practical applications is called nanotechnology.                        NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                                          Today, engineers and researchers are finding a wide variety of methods to deliberately        NaN       make        NaN
     nanoscale materials to take the advantages of their enhanced properties such as higher strength,                        NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                               lighter weight, high chemical reactivity, etc. also the nanotechnology       offers more advances        NaN        NaN         in
  disease treatments, in imaging and diagnostics equipment, in energy efficient products such as fuel                        NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
and solar cells, etc. so in order to move towards the advanced materials and devices, students should                        NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                                                                   have the knowledge of nanoscience.                        NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                        Student learning outcome: After learning the course,students should be able :                        NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                                 • To understand the difference between bulk and nanoscale materials.                        NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                                                     • To understand the basics of nanoscale science.                        NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
       • To understand the synthesizing technique and difficulties to synthesize the nanomaterials so                        NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                  they can get interest in the search of new composition techniques of nanomaterials.                        NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
                          • To understand the various applications of nanoscience and nanotechnology.                        NaN        NaN        NaN        NaN
